intro: Anagallis arvensis f. purpurea, commonly known as the purple mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Primulaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its hairy, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. This variant is distinguished by its more vibrant floral coloration compared to the typical form of Anagallis arvensis.
